page.title: 05INTERESTING PEOPLE.
page.content: { AN INTERVIEW WITH MRS. ROSE MC MILLAN IN 1948 I CAME TO KILMICHAEL-GLASSARY FROM DENMARK WITH MY HUSBAND, WHO HAD BEEN A SOLDIER WITH THE BRITISH ARMY IN THE SECOND WORLD WAR. WHEN I ARRIVED HERE THERE WERE ONLY THREE OR FOUR HOUSES IN THE VILLAGE. I LIVED IN THE {HIGH BUILDING}WITH FIVE OTHER FAMILIES; EACH OF US HAD ONE ROOM AND A KITCHEN. WE HAD NO INSIDE TOILETS, RUNNING WATER, GAS OR ELECTRICITY. WE HAD TO COLLECT WATER FROM A WELL WHICH WAS OPPOSITE THE CHURCH. WE COOKED OUR FOOD OVER AN OPEN FIRE AND OUR HOUSES WERE LIT BY PARAFIN LAMPS. I HAVE SEEN MANY CHANGES. KILMICHAEL FOREST HAS BEEN PLANTED, GROWN TO MATURITY AND NOW MUCH OF IT HAS NOW BEEN CUT DOWN.
